paper_id: LeaFTL: A Learning-Based Flash Translation Layer for Solid-State Drives

triples.evidence: Our evaluation with various storage workloads demonstrates that LeaFTL saves the memory consumption of the mapping table by 2.9× and improves the storage performance by 1.4× on average, in comparison with state-of-the-art FTL schemes.

Our evaluation with various storage workloads demonstrates that LeaFTL saves the memory consumption of the mapping table by 2.9× and improves the storage performance by 1.4× on average, in comparison with state-of-the-art FTL schemes.
LeaFTL can learn various data access patterns and turn them into index segments for reducing the storage cost of the mapping table.
LeaFTL can learn various data access patterns and turn them into index segments for reducing the storage cost of the mapping table.
We implement LeaFTL with a validated SSD simulator WiscSim[27]and evaluate its efficiency with a variety of popular storage workloads.
We implement LeaFTL with a validated SSD simulator WiscSim[27]and evaluate its efficiency with a variety of popular storage workloads.

Our evaluation with various storage workloads demonstrates that LeaFTL saves the memory consumption of the mapping table by 2.9× and improves the storage performance by 1.4× on average, in comparison with state-of-the-art FTL schemes.
